data.title: Division of Student Affairs
data.meta_description: The following designations are used to describe the organization’s status within the University fraternity and sorority life community. Find complete information on proceedings adjudicated in the Student Code of Conduct and in the Office of Fraternity and Sorority Life Policies and Procedures Manual.
data.text:
The following designations are used to describe the organization’s status within the University fraternity and sorority life community. Find complete information on proceedings adjudicated in the Student Code of Conduct and in the Office of Fraternity and Sorority Life Policies and Procedures Manual.

Definition of Status

Good Standing- The fraternity or sorority is not currently in financial, academic, or judicial arrears to the University or their national organization.

Chapter Recolonization- Cessation of operations of the chapter and expulsion or movement to alumni status of all current members by the National Office. The chapter, in conjunction with the National Office, shall submit a recolonization plan for approval to the Dean of Students.

Interim Suspension of Registration- A cessation of organizational operations pending Adjudication of charges filed against a student organization.

Social Probation- The loss of privileges to host, sponsor, co-sponsor, or participate in any social activities.

Suspension of Registration- A cessation of operations of the chapter for a specified period of time, pending fulfillment of specific conditions for reinstatement.

Termination of Registration- Revocation of recognition of the chapter’s charter as a recognized University fraternity or sorority with no established date or conditions for reinstatement. The chapter shall cease its operation at the University.

The following list includes the social fraternities and sororities affiliated with our Pittsburgh campus.
